pr_title: Added Okhttp and ServiceVesion into client test framework

timeline.message: Parameterized HttpClient and ServiceVersion tests for AppConfiguration
Add opens to appconfig junit 5 module
Checkin certificate changes, and partial key changes for keyVaule

timeline.bodyText: Not a huge fan that every test will need to become parameterized to test each client, are there any ways to abstract this into Azure Core Test or does JUnit have the ability to parameterize an entire test run?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: JUnit 4 did support this, but as far as I know, JUnit 5 does not - you now parameterise each test separately.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

replies.bodyText:
First, I'd like to see a description so I can understand why these changes are necessary. Second, I don't believe that pom.xml isn't the correct place to add a core dependency.

Thanks for suggestion! Added the description.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we would want to add APIs into our production code to just handle testing.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: This is decided by Srikanta and Jonathan. @srnagar introduce the logic here. We want to expose the clients to test framework, so we are able to get all clients from test without manual adding clients in test every time. It is under implementation, the only pain is to expose the API to azure-core-test. I think we agree to approach in this way.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Instead of casting this to ConfigurationServiceVersion, the method can directly take in ConfigurationServiceVersion instead of ServiceVersion
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Should this include service version too?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
This is testing null Service Version.
I test it. It is working for not adding version. The display name makes more sense
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: If you are setting the pipeline, shouldn't the httpclient be setup along with the pipeline?
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -157,13 +167,12 @@ public void defaultPipeline() {
             .retryPolicy(new RetryPolicy())
             .configuration(Configuration.getGlobalConfiguration())
             .httpLogOptions(new HttpLogOptions().setLogLevel(HttpLogDetailLevel.BODY_AND_HEADERS))
-            .pipeline(new HttpPipelineBuilder().build());
+            .pipeline(new HttpPipelineBuilder().build())
+            .httpClient(httpClient == null ? interceptorManager.getPlaybackClient() : httpClient)

timeline.bodyText: If you set the pipeline, setting the httpclient on the same builder will have no effect. Pipeline will take precedence.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: This can now be deleted.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Same as above. Pipeline and http client both should not be set.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: Will rework here. Thanks!

timeline.bodyText: This can be deleted.

timeline.bodyText: Set the httpclient in pipeline instead.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: It's really critical that for a client library, you only have this method once. All test classes should reference a single version of this method.
timeline.author: JonathanGiles

replies.bodyText: Will add TestHelper for having this.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.message: Depend on most recent release version for okhttp

timeline.bodyText: The service version should be set on the builder otherwise it will always use the latest.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
Ah, right. Making changes in UserAgent one. Forgot to update here.
Thanks!
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: The service version should be set on the builder otherwise it will always use the latest.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: All client builders are missing service version.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: initializeKeyClient is not the major client we want to test in this class but initializeCryptographyClient. There are another test classes testing KeyClient. What we use for keyClientBuilder are default ones (netty, latest)
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Also, by default, PR builds should just run the tests with latest version and if environment variable to run tests for all versions is set, then we should do this.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: Do we want to introduce new Environment variable to control this?
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText:
Yes. My proposal to @srnagar yesterday was the following:

AZURE_TEST_SERVICE_VERSIONS = all | latest
AZURE_TEST_HTTP_CLIENTS = all | netty

If no environment variable is set, use latest and netty.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

replies.bodyText:
Talked with Srikanta. We only introduce the AZURE_TEST_SERVICE_VERSIONS variable for this PR for the following two reasons.

The client library has no ability to tell the httpClient is instance of Netty or Okhttp in current structure.
HttpClient has no impact on PR validation, as we only run playbackClient for PR.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText:
I later spoke to @sima-zhu and provided sample for enabling HttpClient env variable as well in TestBase's shouldClientBeTested() method.
So, environment variables for both http client and service version should be supported now.
replies.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: Yes. Tested over the method. We can support both variables.
replies.author: sima-zhu

https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/java_implementation.html#service-specific-environment-variables
